Leveraging Space Technology for Agricultural Development and Food Security
Joint Publication by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA)

Download here


Graduate Programs in Space Technology Applications: MASTA and DOCSTA

The RCSSTEAP, affiliated with the United Nations, is pleased to offer 8 postgraduate programs on Space Technology Applications for the 2025 academic year.
Apply before March 15! 

Read more

Space Supporting the Sustainable Development Goals
Space technology and its applications play an important role in supporting the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Find out how space research, technology and applications can help us achieve the SDGs. 

Read more

Space Law for New Space Actors: Fostering Responsible National Space Activities
UNOOSA's Legal Advisory Project "Space Law for New Space Actors" offers Member States tailored capacity building to facilitate drafting of national space legislation in line with international space law.

Read more

In Focus


Space4SDGs
See UNOOSA's 

brochure to understand how space technology and its myriad applications play an important role in supporting the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) established under the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. 





Read more




Access to Space for All
Access to Space for All enables communities from all over the world to use and benefit from space technologies and applications thanks to the cooperation among established space actors, the United Nations and non or emerging space entities.

Read more




UNOOSA Annual Report 2023
For UNOOSA, 2023 was an eventful year of building capacities, advancing gender equality, facilitating space sustainability, enhancing disaster preparedness, raising awareness of the benefits of space and promoting cooperation in space activities. Discover more in the latest Annual Report.

Read more 



Online courses
Studying online boosts career opportunities and broadens horizons. In cooperation with various partners, UNOOSA has launched several online courses in different languages teaching about the space economy, space law and policy, and the long-term sustainability of space activities.

Read more
